net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api

Class Chord

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.music.datatype.api.Chord

  • public class Chord
extends Object
    A Chord is a combination of TonePitches played simultaneously. Typical Chords have a tonal system which is either TonalSystem.MAJOR or TonalSystem.MINOR. Such Chords consists of a least three tones:
    • the fundamental tone
    • the ChromaticInterval.MINOR_THIRD on the fundamental tone for TonalSystem.MINOR or the ChromaticInterval.MAJOR_THIRD on the fundamental tone for TonalSystem.MAJOR.
    • the ChromaticInterval.PERFECT_FIFTH on the fundamental tone.
    Simple examples:
    • the Chord named "C" stands for C- major) and is composed of C, E, and G.
    • the Chord named "cm" stands for c- minor) and is composed of C, E♭, and G.
    Further, a Chord can have extensions that add or remove tones from the Chord. A very common example is ChordExtension._7 that adds a minor seventh relative to the fundamental tone to the Chord. However, there can also be complex combinations such as "Csus4no5add11". Also there are the special extensions ChordExtension.DIM and ChordExtension.AUG that change the chord character totally.
    Finally, a Chord can have a different base tone. This tone is not only added but has to be the lowest tone in the Chord.
    Chords can be inverted what means that the tones except for a base tone (if different from fundamental tone) can be octavated so the order of the tones from lower to higher tones will change. Instances of this Chord class do not distinguish inversions of chords.
    Author:
    hohwille

      • transposeChromatic

        public Chord transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps)
        Like transposeChromatic(int, MusicalKey) but without MusicalKey. Will transpose with normal style.
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will have no change of the pitch.
        Returns:
        the transposed Chord.

      • transposeChromatic

        public Chord transposeChromatic(int semitoneSteps,
                                MusicalKey key)
        Transposes this Chord by the given number of semitoneSteps.
        Parameters:
        semitoneSteps - is the number of semitone steps to transpose. A positive value transposes towards a higher pitch, a negative value transposes towards a lower pitch. A value of zero (0) will have no change of the pitch.
        key - is the used for enharmonic change of the TonePitches.
        Returns:
        the transposed Chord.
        See Also:
        TonePitch.transposeChromatic(int, MusicalKey)

      • transpose

        public Chord transpose(Interval interval,
                       MusicalKey targetKey)
        Transposes this Chord by the given Interval.
        Parameters:
        interval - is the Interval such as e.g. Solmization.MI, ChromaticInterval.MAJOR_THIRD, or DiatonicInterval.THIRD.
        targetKey - is the target key.
        Returns:
        the transposed Chord.
        See Also:
        TonePitch.transposeChromatic(int, MusicalKey)
